decoworld.model.world.combat.events

Class HealthEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoworld.model.world.combat.events.HealthEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CombatEvent

    public class HealthEvent
extends java.lang.Object
implements CombatEvent
    Represents a health event. Health events are sent to objects that have added themselves to a HasHealth object as a listener. See addHealthListener() in HasHealth

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HealthEvent(HasHealth sender, HealthEventType type)
      Creates a new health event.
      HealthEvent(HasHealth sender, HealthEventType type, StatEffect effect)
      Creates a new health event with an associated health effect.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      StatEffect getEffect()
      Returns a StatEffect object associated with this event.
      java.lang.Object getSource()
      Returns the HasHealth object that sent this event.
      java.lang.Enum<HealthEventType> getType()
      Returns the type of health event.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getSource

        public java.lang.Object getSource()
        Returns the HasHealth object that sent this event. For example, if an object died, it would be the source for a death event.
        Specified by:
        getSource in interface CombatEvent
        Returns:
        - the HasHealth object that sent this event.

      • getEffect

        public StatEffect getEffect()
        Returns a StatEffect object associated with this event. If no object exists, returns null.
        Returns:
        - the StatEffect object

      • getType

        public java.lang.Enum<HealthEventType> getType()
        Returns the type of health event. See HealthEventType
        Specified by:
        getType in interface CombatEvent
        Returns:
        type - the type of health event.
